Catherine Connolly assumed office as Ireland's 10th president during a ceremony at Dublin Castle, emphasizing that today's actions will shape future generations. She pledged to foster inclusive dialogue across the island and praised the Good Friday Agreement as a model for peaceful conflict resolution.

The inauguration was attended by Taoiseach Miche√°l Martin, First Minister Michelle O'Neill, and former presidents Mary McAleese and Mary Robinson. Connolly, a former barrister and psychologist who served as a TD since 2016, won by a landslide in October and succeeds Michael D. Higgins after his 14-year presidency.
